definition[0]: if a group of people lay siege to a place, they try to get control by surrounding it
example[0]: The armies laid siege to Vienna in 1529.
definition[1]: to do everything you can to get someone to talk to you or notice you
example[1]: A group of young men were always at the stage door, trying to lay siege to the girls.
definition[2]: if the army or police lay siege to a place, they start a siege against it
example[2]: In June 1176, King Richard laid siege to Limoges.
definition[3]: if you lay siege to someone, you do everything you can to try and get them to talk to you
example[3]: Then he set to work laying siege to her with letters.
